snippet: The star-making system of the future, it turns out, needs the star-making system of the past — or at least a swarm of agents and managers has decided it does.
abstract: Swarm of star-making agents and managers have arrived at YouTube, eroding its status as quintessential do-it-yourself online enterprise; its great promise was its ability to cut out Hollywood-style intermediaries, but now more than 20 agencies and management firms compete to represent YouTube personalities, at least triple the number of three years earlier.

byline.original: By BROOKS BARNES and HUNTER ATKINS
byline.contributor: Brooks Barnes reported from Los Angeles, and Hunter Atkins from New York.

lead_paragraph: The star-making system of the future, it turns out, needs the star-making system of the past — or at least a swarm of agents and managers has decided it does.

headline.main: Hollywood’s Old-Time Star Makers Are Swooping In on YouTube’s Party
headline.print_headline: The Latest YouTube Star Turn? Call My Agent
